Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
CAN: The student can draw a basic image of a plant but may not differentiate between a healthy and unhealthy plant.
The student might include elements like soil and a sun without clear understanding of their roles.
CANNOT: The student is likely unable to show the difference between well-watered and non-watered plants clearly (e.g., both plants might look the same).
The student doesn't depict the importance of light accurately (sun may be present but doesn't indicate the plant growing towards it).
The student cannot show how plant health varies with light and water (e.g., plants always appear static regardless of conditions).
The student misunderstands growth patterns (e.g., random plant shapes not linked to water/light availability).
